comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: This rock cut temple was built (one of two side by side) by Ramses II, 19th dynasty, (1314-1224 B.C.) honoring the Gods Amon Re (Amun Re) Re Horakhte, near Aswan. In 1966 to 1968, they were cut away from the rock face in large pieces, moved to higher ground and reassembled, to save them from the rising water level, due to the Aswan Dam. The facade statues are 67 feet tall. Scale is evident by contrast of tourists at lower right. Simliar image found at: oi.uchicago.edu/gallery/pa_egypt_bees_abu_simbel/index.ph... (photographs from the University of Chicago's Egyptian Expedition, 1905-06)
